project.description: Need to have patients sequenced before running this job

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: consentid
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: the consent abbreviation i.e GRU use "none" for public consents

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: study_type
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: i.e. p/g or p Sequences samples with assumption that subject id = sample id

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash
### assume etl role aws sts assume-role --duration-seconds 900 --role-arn arn:aws:iam::736265540791:role/dbgap-etl --role-session-name "s3-test" > assume-role-output.txt
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=`grep AccessKeyId assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=`grep SecretAccessKey assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SESSION_TOKEN=`grep SessionToken assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"`
mkdir data mkdir completed mkdir hierarchies mkdir processing
find data/ -type f -exec rm -rf {} \; find processing/ -type f -exec rm -rf {} \; find completed/ -type f -exec rm -rf {} \; rm -rf pic-sure-hpds/
aws s3 cp ${managed_inputs} .
unset AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID unset AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY unset AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
csvcut -c 1,2,3,8,9 Managed_Inputs.csv > inputs.csv
aws sts assume-role --duration-seconds 3600 --role-arn arn:aws:iam::736265540791:role/dbgap-etl --role-session-name "s3-test" > assume-role-output.txt
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=`grep AccessKeyId assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=`grep SecretAccessKey assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SESSION_TOKEN=`grep SessionToken assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"`
aws s3 cp s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${abv_name,,}/data/${abv_name^^}_PatientMapping.v2.csv data/
java -jar jars/GenericGlobalConceptsGenerator.jar -study_type ${study_type,,} -rootnode ${phs_accession} -patientmappingfile data/${abv_name^^}_PatientMapping.v2.csv -trialid ${abv_name^^} -consentid ${consentid} -accession ${phs_accession}
aws s3 cp completed/${abv_name^^}_GlobalVars.csv s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${abv_name,,}/completed/
